description: Campbell Soup Company controls about 50 percent of the soup market, which is far less than the 144-year-old company used to. In order to start growing again, Campbell's has introduced a new line of soups specifically for millennials, but the results have been lukewarm. The government of Bulgaria has quit after nationwide protests against austerity measures. And a new report says college fundraisers brought in $31 billion in donations last year, with a full billion of that going to Stanford University.
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Wednesday, February 20, 2013

byline: David Weinberg, Amy Scott, Nancy Marshall-Genzer, David Brancaccio, Molly Wood, Bruce Johnson, Sam Beard, Paddy Hirsch, Jeremy Hobson and Karen Clark
title: Marketplace Morning Report for Wednesday, February 20, 2013
